beans.description: This example illustrates the use of oa3 Expressions (using Ordered Maps) Simple example to add attribute with value conditional on the value of another. Data originates: File Data processed : XML Records (with typed attributes) converted to Ordered Maps Data processed : Various expressions are applied to the maps Data terminates: Delimited Text to stdout

bean.description: Read in an xml document consisting of multiple (child) records. Then convert each record into an ordered map. (See XML examples for more information on this process)

property.name: expression
property.description: (Default is to include the root node.) This expression will select all nodes under the root node, excluding the root note itself. Useful for our multi-element structure: <root> <record1></record1> <record2></record2> </root>

property.name: omitTopLevelElementTag
property.description: As we don't want each record to retain it's parent tag, to set omitTopLevelElementTag to true.

property.name: valueTypeAttributeName
property.description: If available, this will hint at the attribute type Currently supported values are Double, Long, Date and String.

bean.description: This example illustrates setting an attribute value depending on the result of a boolean expression, e.g. the info attribute will get 'lots' when quantity is more than 4, or 'few' otherwise.
